instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00164: What is 820-00164? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_WLAN: What is PP3V3_WLAN? PP3V3_WLAN is a 3.3v power rail that powers the wifi circuit or wifi card. This can go missing when the inductor acting as a fuse before PP3V3_WLAN blows..
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water Damage
threads.message:
Hey guys,

I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> which is giving some problems. Okay so originally it came on with no wifi (not turning on). I checked and <SIGNAL>PP3V3_WLAN</SIGNAL> was only 2.64v. I tested this with board still in frame. Took it out the frame and saw corrosion around L4605. Cleaned that and the system wont boot. G3H was only 2v. Changed the ISL and <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> then g3H was back to normal but still no power. Noticed the 3.3v line was missing , checked out <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> and corrosion was on the pins . Changed that now 3.3v is back but still no power. Looked again under the scope and the EFI had some corrosion, I reflowed it and boom fan spin. Feeling all satisfied I put the unit back together to see if WLAN would be back and no power again. Checking <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> in frame I am getting 8.64 volts for 3 secs then it drops to 4v then back to 8.64v in a continuous loop. What can be the problem? Or where should I start?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water Damage
threads.message:
Still corrosion problems.
Check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>.
Inspect the areas where you applied heat to change components.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water Damage
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water Damage
threads.message: after taking the efi off, cleaning and added fresh solder i have fan spin again out of frame but still fluctuating g3h

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water Damage
threads.message: Remove F7140 and check if <CAPACITOR>C7140</CAPACITOR> voltage is steady.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water Damage
threads.message: <CAPACITOR>C7140</CAPACITOR> is fluctuating with the F7140 removed

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water Damage
threads.message: I am guessing something on the charger side because I have constant voltage on battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water Damage
threads.message:
Post <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> voltages; pins 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 19, 20, 27.
Monitor them for fluctuation.
